intro: Chaerophyllum azoricum, commonly known as the Azorean cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Azores, an archipelago in the North Atlantic. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
